OVERLAY_CONFIG_DESC: Configure the I2S overlay for your ES9018K2M board.
BOARD_TYPE_DESC: Select based on whether your DAC board has an onboard crystal oscillator. Type A boards need MCLK signal from Raspberry Pi GPIO4. Type B boards generate their own clock.
REBOOT_REQUIRED_NOTICE: Changing the overlay requires a reboot to take effect.
SELECT_DAC_FIRST: Please select i2s-dac in Volumio Playback Options first
SELECT_DAC_FIRST_DESC: No DAC overlay is configured. Please go to Volumio Settings > Playback Options > I2S DAC, select 'i2s-dac' (or 'Generic I2S DAC'), and reboot. Then return here to configure the ES9018K2M overlay.
OVERLAY_READY: DAC overlay detected - ready to configure
OVERLAY_READY_DESC: A compatible DAC overlay is configured. Select your board type below and click 'Apply and Reboot' to enable ES9018K2M support with fixed 64FS bitclock.
OVERLAY_CONFIGURED_DESC: ES9018K2M overlay is configured and active. You can change board type if needed, or proceed to configure the DAC settings below.
OVERLAY_OTHER_DESC: An incompatible DAC overlay is configured. Please go to Volumio Settings > Playback Options > I2S DAC, select 'i2s-dac' (or 'Generic I2S DAC'), and reboot. Then return here to configure the ES9018K2M overlay.
OVERLAY_APPLIED: Overlay configuration saved. Please reboot for changes to take effect.
DEVICE_NOT_FOUND: ES9018K2M not detected. Check I2C connection, address, and ensure overlay is configured and system has been rebooted.
I2C_BUS_DESC: I2C bus number (usually 1 for Raspberry Pi)
I2C_ADDRESS_DESC: Device address in hex (default: 0x48). Common addresses: 0x48, 0x49, 0x4A, 0x4B
BALANCE_DESC: Adjust left/right channel balance. Negative values reduce right channel, positive values reduce left channel. Range: -40 to +40 (0.5dB steps).
FIR_DESC: Finite Impulse Response filter shape. Fast roll-off is default. Minimum phase may reduce pre-ringing.
IIR_DESC: Infinite Impulse Response filter bandwidth. Use 47K for PCM audio, higher values for DSD content.
DEEMPHASIS_DESC: De-emphasis filter for pre-emphasized recordings. Usually leave Off unless playing vintage CDs.
DPLL_DESC: Digital Phase-Locked Loop settings for jitter reduction. Higher values provide more jitter reduction but may cause issues with some sources.
I2S_DPLL_DESC: DPLL bandwidth for I2S/PCM sources. Level 5 is a good starting point.
CONFIRM_RESET: Reset all DAC settings to factory defaults?
